mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Burwell Bassett, 1799 August 11
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Some time ago a mulatto girl, body servant to Mrs. Washington, ran away -- she was found in Portsmouth, New Hampshire -- asks Bassett that since he is going to Portsmouth, would he take steps to send her back -- a Frenchman enticed her away but has left her -- if she causes no further trouble, she won't be punished -- Washington doesn't wish him to do anything "unpleasant, or troublesome" to bring her back. Autograph letter signed, Letter Press Copy, docketed by George Washington, laminated.
